examples: she loved travel, with all its concomitant worries
concomitant with his obsession with dirt was a desire for order

noun.description: A phenomenon that naturally accompanies or follows something.
examples: some of us look on pain and illness as concomitants of the stresses of living

origin: Early 17th century: from late Latin concomitant- accompanying, from concomitari, from con- together with + comitari, from Latin comes companion.
